title: Shorthand for Git upstream (tracked) remote branch
content:
It's @{u}.

 For example, if you are on master branch, and master branch is tracked with origin/master. You can use git merge @{u} instead of git merge origin/master.

 Reference:Â https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Branching-Remote-Branches#upstream-shorthand-k9UotnHmIO
author: Tap
